answers.answer: We don't look at pictures.This would have nothing to do with a STD or HIV. Sounds like irritation, see a Dr if concerned.

No STD does anything like this. With the spots coming and going so quickly, it's probably just superficial blood vessels becoming more prominent with stimulation and changes in blood flow. Or if you're uncircumcised maybe minor inflammation (called balanitis) due to yeast, hygiene, etc. Check with your doctor if you remain concerned, but probably it's anything to worry about.
thank u but i feel a burning sensation when i get this

I get the same thing, but on the shaft. Do you rub more on the head when masterbating? It's probably light balanitis or irritation, I highly doubt it's a std. Just wash it with mild soap everyday and keep it dry. They should clear up in 3 days the longest.

This is a nonprofessional community forum and not a substitute for professional evaluation in person. If the problem doesn't clear up with the hygiene suggested by Trystayclean, see a doctor or clinic. But for sure this isn't an STD.
than u all for the info i saw a doctor he had given me a serum and urine test for diabetes waiting for result will keep u posted
diabetes test for serum fasting was 83mg/dl after food 1.5 hrs was 101urine was nill

This suggests your doctor thought the problem was a yeast infection, which can be a sign of diabetes. In any case, no STD, which is the only topic for this forum, so I won't have any further comments or advice.
